definitions: feeling worried, nervous, or afraid about an uncertain outcome or situation
strongly wishing for something to happen, especially with impatience
examples: She was anxious about her upcoming job interview
The anxious parents waited for news from the hospital
He's anxious to start his new position next month
The children were anxious for the vacation to begin

definitions: showing or feeling no interest, enthusiasm, or concern about things
examples: The apathetic voters stayed home on election day
She seemed apathetic about her failing grades

definitions: tending to arouse sexual desire or excitement when consumed or experienced
examples: Oysters are considered an aphrodisiac food by many cultures
The perfume had an aphrodisiac effect on her partner

definitions: relating to, located at, or forming the apex or tip of something
examples: The apical bud controls the plant's vertical growth
Apical dominance prevents lower branches from growing

definitions: describing or prophesying the complete destruction of the world or civilization
relating to or characteristic of an apocalypse or prophetic revelation
examples: The movie depicted an apocalyptic wasteland after nuclear war
Scientists warned of apocalyptic consequences from climate change
The preacher delivered an apocalyptic sermon about judgment day
Ancient apocalyptic texts describe visions of the end times

definitions: of doubtful authenticity, although widely circulated as being true or genuine
examples: The apocryphal story about Washington and the cherry tree
Many apocryphal tales surround the company's founding

definitions: not interested or involved in politics or political activities
examples: She remained apolitical throughout the election campaign
The organization claims to be completely apolitical

definitions: showing or expressing regret and asking for forgiveness for a fault or offense
examples: He gave an apologetic smile after spilling the coffee
Her apologetic tone made it clear she was sorry

definitions: having abandoned one's religious faith, political party, or cause
examples: The apostate priest was excommunicated from the church
He was considered apostate by his former political allies

definitions: relating to the apostles or their teachings, especially in Christianity
examples: The apostolic succession links modern bishops to the original apostles
They follow apostolic traditions dating back two thousand years

definitions: greatly dismayed, shocked, or horrified by something unexpected or unpleasant
examples: She was appalled by the conditions in the prison
The appalled witnesses couldn't believe what they saw

definitions: causing shock, dismay, or horror by being unexpectedly bad or unpleasant
examples: The appalling conditions forced immediate intervention
Her appalling behavior shocked everyone at the party

definitions: clearly visible or understood; obvious to perception or understanding
appearing to be true or real but not necessarily so
examples: The damage to the building was immediately apparent
His apparent enthusiasm impressed the interview panel
Despite his apparent confidence, he was actually nervous
The apparent winner was later disqualified

definitions: attractive, interesting, or pleasing in a way that captures attention or desire
examples: The appealing design attracted many buyers
She has an appealing personality that draws people in

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a person who appeals a legal decision
examples: The appellant party filed their brief yesterday
Appellant jurisdiction determines which court hears the case

definitions: relating to appeals or the legal process of reviewing lower court decisions
examples: The appellate court reversed the lower court's decision
She specializes in appellate law and procedure

definitions: relevant, suitable, or appropriate to a particular situation, person, or circumstance
examples: These rules are applicable to all employees
The discount is only applicable during weekdays

definitions: put to practical use rather than being theoretical or abstract
examples: She teaches applied mathematics to engineering students
Applied research focuses on solving real-world problems

definitions: officially assigned to a position, job, or role by someone in authority
examples: The newly appointed director starts work Monday
She arrived at the appointed time for the meeting

definitions: large or important enough to be noticed, measured, or have a significant effect
examples: There was an appreciable difference in quality
The delay caused appreciable losses to the company

definitions: recognized as valuable, important, or significant and treated with gratitude
examples: Your help would be greatly appreciated
She felt appreciated by her new colleagues

definitions: feeling, expressing, or showing gratitude, pleasure, or approval for something
examples: The appreciative audience gave a standing ovation
He was appreciative of all the support he received

definitions: seized, arrested, or taken into custody, especially by legal authority
examples: The apprehended suspect was taken to the station
All apprehended individuals have the right to an attorney

definitions: anxious or fearful that something bad or unpleasant will happen
examples: She felt apprehensive about meeting his parents
The apprehensive students awaited their exam results

meanings: friendly and easy to talk to
definitions: friendly and easy to talk to; willing to listen and respond positively
examples: Despite her fame, she remained approachable and humble
The approachable manager encouraged open communication

definitions: coming nearer in distance, time, or amount; getting closer
examples: The approaching storm forced everyone indoors
With approaching retirement, he began making plans

definitions: suitable, fitting, or proper for a particular person, purpose, or situation
examples: Please wear appropriate clothing for the interview
Her response was appropriate given the circumstances

definitions: officially accepted, sanctioned, or agreed to by an authority or group
examples: Only approved vendors can bid on this contract
The approved plan will be implemented next month

definitions: showing or expressing approval, agreement, or a favorable opinion
examples: She gave him an approving nod
His approving comments boosted team morale

definitions: close to the actual value or amount but not completely accurate or exact
examples: The approximate cost will be five thousand dollars
Can you give me an approximate arrival time?

definitions: having a natural tendency or likelihood to do something
quick to learn or understand things; mentally alert
appropriate or suitable in the circumstances
examples: She's apt to forget things when she's stressed
He's apt to exaggerate when telling stories
An apt pupil who mastered the material quickly
She proved an apt student of languages
That's an apt description of the situation
His apt remarks captured the mood perfectly

definitions: relating to, living in, or taking place in water environments
examples: Dolphins are aquatic mammals that breathe air
The resort offers various aquatic sports and activities

definitions: based on random choice or personal whim rather than reason or system
examples: The deadline seemed arbitrary and unreasonable
Arbitrary rules often frustrate the employees

definitions: understood by very few people; mysterious, secret, or obscure
examples: The arcane rituals of the ancient society
He specialized in arcane areas of constitutional law

definitions: playfully teasing or mischievous in manner or tone
chief, principal, or preeminent, especially in something bad
examples: She gave him an arch look and smiled knowingly
His arch comments amused everyone at dinner
He was her arch rival in the competition
The arch villain appeared in the final scene

definitions: relating to the study of human history through excavation and analysis of artifacts
examples: The archaeological dig uncovered ancient pottery
Archaeological evidence suggests the site is prehistoric

definitions: very old, belonging to an earlier period, or no longer in common use
examples: The archaic language made the text difficult to understand
Their archaic computer system needs urgent updating

definitions: having a curved shape like an arch or forming an arch
examples: The cat's arched back signaled its fear
They walked through the arched doorway into the garden

definitions: representing the most typical or perfect example of a particular kind of person or thing
examples: He's the archetypal absent-minded professor
This is an archetypal example of Gothic architecture

definitions: forming or moving in a curved line or shape like an arch
examples: The arching branches created natural shade
Her arching eyebrows expressed her surprise

definitions: relating to the design and construction of buildings and structures
examples: The architectural plans were approved by the city
She admired the architectural beauty of the cathedral

definitions: relating to or constituting archives or historical records for long-term preservation
examples: The archival footage showed life in the 1920s
They use archival quality paper for important documents

definitions: extremely cold, with temperatures well below freezing point
relating to the region around the North Pole
examples: Arctic temperatures made outdoor work impossible
The arctic wind cut through their winter coats
Arctic wildlife has adapted to extreme conditions
The arctic expedition lasted three months

definitions: very enthusiastic, passionate, or showing strong positive feelings about something
examples: She's an ardent supporter of environmental causes
His ardent love for music inspired his career

definitions: involving or requiring strenuous effort; difficult, tiring, and demanding
examples: The arduous climb to the summit took twelve hours
Writing the thesis was an arduous task

definitions: open to disagreement, dispute, or differing interpretations
capable of being argued or maintained as possibly true
examples: It's arguable whether the policy actually helps
The decision's benefits are arguable at best
It's arguable that technology has made life easier
This is arguably the best solution available

definitions: given to arguing or disposed to disagree and dispute with others
examples: His argumentative nature made meetings difficult
She becomes argumentative when she's tired

definitions: having little or no rain; very dry and often barren
lacking interest, excitement, or meaning; dull and lifeless
examples: The arid desert receives less than ten inches of rain yearly
Arid conditions make farming nearly impossible
His arid writing style put readers to sleep
The arid lecture hall emptied quickly

definitions: belonging to or typical of the aristocracy or nobility
having the qualities associated with nobility such as dignity and refinement
examples: Her aristocratic family owned several estates
The aristocratic tradition dates back centuries
His aristocratic bearing commanded immediate respect
She had an aristocratic disdain for popular culture

definitions: relating to arithmetic, the branch of mathematics dealing with numbers and calculations
examples: Simple arithmetic operations include addition and subtraction
The arithmetic mean is calculated by dividing the sum by the count
